page.title: 19Aycliffe Village-old church
page.content: Christianity was first established in Aycliffe at a very early date,for two great Synods of the Church were held there in 782 and 789A.D.The Church at that time was dedicated to St.Acca,a local priest who became Bishop of Hexham.At the time of the Reformation it was re-dedicated to the better known St.Andrew,Apostle & Missionary. The present Church was built in 1215. The people of the village suffered severely at the time of the Great Plague and also at the time of the Commonwealth,for many villagers who were Royalists were executed by Cromwell's troops.King Charles I worshipped in the Church and,after the restoration of the monarchy,Charles II also worshipped there.St.Andrew's is the Mother Church of St.Clare's of Newton Aycliffe,which was built when the new town was created.
